data.prayer: Jesus, please send your Spirit to Tongliao, so they can have freedom.
data.verse: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Tongliao, Nei Mongol, China
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, help every believer in Tongliao, Nei Mongol, China be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks them for the reason for their hope.
data.verse: But in your hearts revere Christ as Lord. Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do this with gentleness and respect.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 13 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Father, please give the people in the county of Tongliao access to a Bible in their own language.
Spirit, give the disciples of the the county of Tongliao words, actions, signs and wonders to proclaim the coming of the Kingdom.
data.verse: As you go, proclaim this message: "The kingdom of heaven has come near."

data.prayer: Lord, the believers in the county of Tongliao, Nei Mongol, China need teachers who can feed them with knowledge and understanding. Please raise them up.
data.verse: Then I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.

data.prayer: Father, we pray for every movement leader and disciple in the county of Tongliao, Nei Mongol, China that they would have deepening intimacy with you.
data.verse: On that day you will realize that I am in my Father, and you are in me, and I am in you.

data.section_summary:
the county of Tongliao, Nei Mongol, China has a population of 847,200.

We estimate Tongliao has 64,270 people who might know Jesus, 13,686 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 769,244 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 13 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Father, be a refuge and strength for the hurting in Tongliao, Nei Mongol, China today.
data.verse: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.
